"But it's 95 degrees (35 in Celsius)," Sheldon.
"I never said it was cold, I just said 'I' was feeling cold," snapped Penny and used the opportunity to bustle down the stairs.
Leonard and Sheldon stood there for a moment until Sheldon said, "The weird she shouldn't be acting like this for another two weeks."

Penny got to the cheese cake factory without any trouble (other than having to move the driver's seat in her car back and make sure that the effort hadn't caused to leak expectantly), her supervisor told her take of the coat when working so people could see she was a waitress, but lucky enough was too busy to pay much attention to her and not see her belly. Another thing she had to endure was the hunger, she kept wanting to eat people's unfinished meals as she took them to the kitchen, but the rest of her reminded how disgusting that would be, and it probably was against employee rules.

After the morning shift and Penny had a quick lunch break she didn't know what to do, ask for the rest of the day off (her supervisor would probably let her if she drew their attention to her belly) or continue work in the afternoon shift and face interrogation from Bernadette. Her belly gave a groan, either way she needed to get something to eat.

How can they all be gone?"..."and who do you think could eat four whole cheese cakes?"..."For your information Penny is right now as sick as a dog, if it was only one cheese cake I would agree with you but since it's all four and Penny hasn't exploded we assume that she didn't eat the rest of today's cheese' cake by herself, now go and find them or it will be you telling the customers why there is no cheese cakes at the cheese cake factory."

1511211221.title: Ask for the rest of the day off.

151121122112.content:
Penny decided to go home, something was wrong with her and she was going to figure out what to do about. She got back to the building went inside, she hadn’t thought about the stairs. As her rather obvious waddle now indicated, the strain of her unbeknownst children was making it difficult to walk as it was and she had to walk up to the fourth floor. She pressed one of the buttons for the elevator in the vain hope that, despite the ‘Out of Order’ sign, it had been fixed. There was no response so Penny made her way up the stair, the trip took much longer than usual as she had to stop and catch her breath half way up, it wasn’t helping that she was also getting really hot with the large coat on. Five minutes after entering the building, Penny stumbled through the door way of her apartment. After closing the door she took of the coat, “oooh, that’s better,” she said casting it aside, “I felt like I was going to cook.”

She went and had a shower, not surprisingly her bra had come undone at some point during the day and fell to the floor as soon as she took her shirt off, what was surprising was the fact that her navel had popped out. She viewed herself in the mirror hand on her belly, “good god, I look like I’m frickin pregnant,” she said in regards to her body in general but mostly her belly which was approaching the six months mark. She finished getting undressed and hopped in the shower, as with last night, her hands kept absentmindedly rubbing her belly, and despite all the problems it was causing, rubbing her belly made her feel extremely relaxed. She stood there for nearly half an hour rubbing her swollen belly until a kick from inside it broke her reverie. The nearly caused her to fall over, she hurriedly turn off the water and hopped out of the shower and looked pointedly at her belly. Other than sticking out much further than normal it didn’t seem odd. “You’re imaging things,” she said patting her belly, “just because you look pregnant doesn’t mean you are pregnant.” She put on the sports bra and a matching set of panties, she put on pair of short denim shorts which she did up under her ‘bump’ after having trouble getting them over her hips and backside and a pink singlet that nothing to cover the majority of her belly.

She made her out into the living area, “What am I going to do?” she asked herself. Her belly as though in response gave a groan, “what?! I ate enough for twenty people today I can’t be hungry,” another groan from her belly and a pang of hunger from her belly told her otherwise. It didn’t in fact it so how made her hungrier, “uuuuuhhh, how I still be hungry,” just then her eye caught sight of the spare key to Sheldon’s and Leonard’s apartment, surely they wouldn’t mind if she had some food…

“No they’re not,” interjected Sheldon.
“Quiet Sheldon,” snapped Leonard. This seemed to calm Penny and she spent the rest of trip trying to clean herself up.

When they got to the hospital Leonard quickly ran around open the back passenger door and told Sheldon to get a wheelchair. “For goodness sake Leonard,” said Penny angrily, “I’m not that fat,” she got out of the car and made her way inside.
The three of them walked up to the front desk which was staffed by the dry witted African-American lady who seemed to do nearly every reception job in the city. She looked up at them from her crossword, “Can I help you?” she ask pointedly.
“We need to find out what going on with Penny,” said Leonard gesturing to her.
The receptionist looked Penny up and down before simply saying, “she pregnant,” before going back her crossword.
“But she can’t be she didn’t look like this a couple of day ago,” said Leonard.
“Well you should of brought her in a couple of day ago.”
“Can you please book her to see someone.”
“It’s you time lost, please take a seat,” she said gesturing to a row of plastic seats with armrests moulded on to them.
They didn't end up sitting down to wait, Sheldon refused to touch anything if he could help it, this included the seats, Penny, much to her embarrassment was too big to fit in to one and Leonard felt out of place if he was the only one sitting so the three stood there until the doctor arrived who was…
15112112211211.title: She layed their until found.

151121122112111.content:
“Ok miss Penelope… oh,” there was an awkward pause as Stephanie Barnett, Leonard red headed ex, looked up from a clipboard saw him, there was an even longer more awkward pause when she saw the extremely pregnant Penny next to him. The silence was by Penny lumber forward and saying flatly, “It’s not what looks like.” Her and Stephanie started to make their way into the depths of the hospital, Leonard went to follow them. “You two stay here,” said Penny.

“Why do you think she said that?” asked Leonard, watching the two women retreating.
“Because she wanted us to stay here,” answered Sheldon.
“Thanks Sheldon,” replied Leonard sarcastically.

Meanwhile Stephanie had led Penny into a room and gestured to a low bed which Penny graciously plopped on to. “So you’ve grown a lot since I saw you,” said Stephanie in a friendly voice, whilst turning on an ultrasound machine.
“It’s not Leonard’s,” blurted out Penny.
“Whose is it?” Stephanie said wheeling the ultrasound over and sat down next to Penny.
“I don’t know, I mean no one’s I mean…the other day I wasn’t I mean I was skinnier than you and now…,” Penny started tearing up again.
“Well, we’ll find out what’s going on in there shall we,” said Stephanie and started to rub gel onto Penny’s belly, as with the caressing Penny gave her belly in the shower, Stephanie’s hands and then the ultrasound machine rubbing on her belly made Penny feel calm and relaxed. This revere was broken when Stephanie said “Congratulations, Penny you definitely are pregnant.”
“What?!” said Penny jolting, Stephanie turned the screen for Penny to see.
“There’s at least…

How many babies is Penny carrying?
151121122112111.title: Stephanie Barnett (one of Leonard's ex girl...

1511211221121112.content: How many babies is Penny carrying?
1511211221121112.title: More

15112112211211121.content:
“There’s at least ten in there, but it's very hard to tell with some many” said Stephanie patting Penny’s belly, which wobbled slightly.
“But how…who…what?” stuttered Penny.
“Relax,” said Stephanie kindly, “I need to requisition some tests, is there anything I can get you?”
Penny’s belly on cue gave a gurgle, “Maybe something to eat, but not too much though.”

Then visitors entered the room, who were…
15112112211211121.title: at least 10

choices: One of them suggests they get something to eat
1511211221121112121.content:
Sometime later as Penny was finishing off her twenty something jellocup, “Amazing,” said Stephanie measuring Penny’s belly for the second time in half an hour.
“Wut?,” said Penny her mouth full.
“Since I last measured your belly, it has grown by four inches.”
“Hey bestie how you goi…woah swelled up fast,” said a voice the doorway, Penny tried to look around her belly to see who it was even though only one person would say that, then Amy (as said before Amy was Sheldon’s ‘girlfriend’) came into view along with Bernadette (Howard’s wife who worked part time at cheese cake factory to pay off her graduate school fees and now works for a pharmaceutical company).
“We came as soon as we heard of your…,” said Bernadette glancing at Penny’s belly, “...illness,” she finished.
“I think I know what you got,” said Amy, “It called Pseudocyesis or false pregnancy, you only look pregnant because you think you are.”
“That’s because she is pregnant,” said Stephanie, “very pregnant.”
Amy turned to face her, “Your supposed to tell her that she isn’t, how is she supposed to be cured if you keep telling her that,” she turned back to Penny, as Stephanie switched on the ultrasound, “You’re not pregnant Penny, You’re not pregnant Penny, you’re not pre…” there was a moment silence as Amy looked at the screen before she said, “Blimey Penny, either you have a really good imagination or you pregnant.”

Just then there was a flash of bright light, Penny woke up in the strange room surrounded by the tall lanky figures again. She looked around and saw Amy, Bernadette and Stephanie on either side of her on similar operating tables. She couldn’t make out the figures clearly like last time but she could hear them arguing.
“Why did you do that then someone could of seen it,” said one harshly.
“Don’t worry no one saw it besides I needed to make sure we got all of them,” snapped the other.
“All of them you don’t plan to…”
“Yes the forces from the Andromeda galaxy will find our sanctuary one day and we need to have the numbers when they do.”
“But they are not optimized for breeding like this one,” said the first one gesturing at Penny.
“We’ll give the half the number then, so they have a chance of carrying them to full term.”
“That won’t change the chance of complications.”
“Which is why I have no problem giving them a growth accelerant, that way they’ll give birth at the same time as this one, who past all our expectations,” said the second one walking over to Penny reaching out a long hand. As in response the children inside Penny began to thrash as kick wildly, Penny wanted to scream but she seemed unable to, the last thing she heard before blacking out was, “can you believe that in a few days she will give births to sixteen.”

Penny then jolted awake, she was lying on the hospital bed, the memory of the room and the lanky things evaporating from her mind like it was a dream. She looked around to see the other all passed out in chairs or against the wall, “What happen?” said Penny. Just then Stephanie’s eyes fluttered open and she groggily said the same thing. Soon Bernadette woke up with the same confusion and finally Amy who without opening her eyes blearily said “Oh, Sheldon I love it when you touch me that way.”
They all then looked at each other, none of them wanting to be the first to say something until…
1511211221121112121.title: Bernadette and Amy

15112112211211121211.content:
The silence was broken by rumble from someone’s stomach; no one knew who as it all seem to emanate from all of them. The was another few seconds of silence before Penny asked jokingly, “Anyone else hungry?” There was hurried agreement followed by heading to the door.

It was several hours later, “I just don’t know what’s gotten into Penny,” said Leonard. He and Sheldon after taking Penny to the hospital, had gone shopping to replace some of the food Penny had eaten (Sheldon wasn’t going to return to the apartment until the emergency kit was restocked). On the way back they had picked up Howard and Raj, and now the four of them were back at the apartment playing Jenga. “I tell you what’s got into her,” said Sheldon, he held up a piece of paper, “two and half liters of milk, eight slices of bread including one crust, half a packet of f…”
“Why have you listed all the food she’s eaten?”
“So she can repay us for it, as I was saying half a packe…”
“You not going to make her give the exact amount of food back,” said Leonard sternly.
“She doesn’t have to give the eight slices of bread, a full loaf will be fine.”
Leonard sighed he too much to think about without dealing with Sheldon, he sort it out later.
“I still find it hard to believe that Penny was able to eat that much food,” said Howard carefully removing a block, “I mean to have a figure like hers she would have to be the kind of girl measures her intake.”
“That the other thing, she looks pregnant,” said Leonard.
“Have you ever considered that she might be,” said Raj taking his turn, “I mean maybe she and s…
“You saw her last week, and now she looks like she ready to give birth any day now, I mean I know of women popping overnight but she looks ready to exploded.”
“Well maybe she’s just been you know,” said Howard, “sucking it in, she might not want to upset you and…
“Not unless she had a pocket dimension or something, she looked nine months ok.”
Just then they heard a loud thudding from down stairs and getting closer as though someone was ascending the stairs. As it got closer the Jenga tower collapsed, “Howard, you’re meant tell us if your mother was coming over to see where you are,” said Leonard.
“At this time, no, she got several of her favorite show on tv around this time until nine-thirty I could dying in hospital and should would leave the couch,” said Howard, “which is a nice change,” he continued mostly to himself.
There was the sound of voices coming up from the stair well, the four of them clustered around the door to listen.
“Hurry up… yeah come on… I trying some of us have more to carry than others…just because you eat yours…”
“I can hear Bernadette,” said Howard, “and possibly Amy.”
“I can hear Penny,” said Leonard, “and I think,” he looked puzzled for a moment, “Stephanie?”
“Your ex Stephanie?” inquire Raj in a whisper.
“Yeah.”

They listen for another minute or so as the girls made their way into the other apartment, “Well that’s that,” said Howard in matter a fact voice heading back to the chairs.
“Could any of you hear what they were saying?” asked Leonard.
Raj gave a shrug, “Nope not really,” he said, “what are watching tonight?”
“Doctor who, the first six episode of the second doctor,” said Sheldon getting the tv set up as the rest cleared up the jenga blocks

Several minutes into the second episode there was a knock at the door, when Leonard opened the door he saw that it was…
15112112211211121211.title: One of them suggests they get something to eat

1511211221121112121121.content:
Amy Farrah Fowler came rushing through room knocking Leonard aside as she did, “CanIuseyourbathroom?” she said without wait for response.

“What was that she said?” asked Howard as Sheldon paused the tv.
“Something about the bathroom,” said Leonard, “guy did she seem a bit…thicker round the middle I mean?”
“Probably just you imagination,” said Howard, “plus the clothes she wears probably makes it seem like that as well.”
“You’re probably right,” said Leonard sitting down.” They were just about to start doctor who again when they heard Amy being sick nosily.
“Sheldon maybe you should ask her if she is feeling well?” said Leonard after moment.
“Why? I know she isn’t feeling well.”
“Perhaps you could ask her why?”
“Fine.”

When Amy came back a few minutes later her stomach did seem to be sticking out slightly.
After some meaning looks from the others Sheldon asked, “Why did you throw up?”
“Because I had some milk that was past it’s used by date, Bernadette had some mouldy cheese, she ended up going to Penny’s bathroom, which is why I came here.”
“Why are you two eating off dairy products?” asked Leonard incredulously.
“In was only few day past its used by date and we were too hungry to wait until the pizzas arrived.”
“How much food had today?” asked Leonard.
“Quite a bit,” said Amy unabashedly lifting her shirt and exposing her stomach which had a distinct curve to it as though she was really bloated.
The guys looked at it in silence for a moment before a gurgling from Amy’s belly followed by a belch broke the silence. She dropped her shirt and heading over to Penny’s apartment saying “so cool hanging out with my bestie.”
“Okay something is definitely going on with them,” said Leonard, “and I think we should check it out.”

The general consensus was…
1511211221121112121121.title: Amy

choices: Follow the guys to the university
Follow the girls to the mall
15112112211211121211211.content:
“Okay something is definitely going on with them,” said Leonard, “and I think we should check it out.”
“Don’t be so senseless,” said Sheldon, “if it is some sort of contagious illness then we should get as far away from them as possible.”
“Well I for one would like to know why my wife is eating moldy cheese,” said Howard.
“What about you Raj?” said Leonard.
“I have trouble believing Penny is big as you say, I have to see for myself.”

After coaxing Sheldon to come who would only go over to Penny’s apartment with a face mask and two sets of rubber gloves on, the guys knocked on Penny’s door.
“It’s open,” said Penny’s voice.
Leonard opened the door and they all stood there in stunned silence with the exception of Sheldon, “OH My!”

Penny’s apartment which was never rather tidy at the best was now littered with empty food packets. To add to this the girls were lounging around lethargically furniture, with Bernadette and Stephanie seemed to be as bloated as Amy. But all this was secondary detail to Penny whose belly looked full term even possibly overdue, the pink singlet scrunched up beneath her breasts.
“Oh I thought you were the Pizza guys,” said Penny.
“What is going on here?” asked Leonard.
“Just having dinner with my friends,” said Penny.
Howard crossed the room to Bernadette, “Baby are you alright? What been going on?”
“Just a bit peckish, Howie,” replied Bernadette, rubbing her belly which was peeking out beneath her shirt.

Meanwhile, “This is a lot of food,” said Leonard.
“You have to a lot of food when you pregnant,” said Penny.
“So are pregnant then?”
“Yup,” said Penny lightly slapping her belly, “got at least ten of the little guys inside me.”
“TEN! but to have many you need to be on some sort of fertility drug or something,” said Leonard.
“Well maybe some radioactive stuff leaking out from your apartment made my hyper-fertile,” replied Penny giving a giggle.
“Exposure radioactive material makes people sterile and we don’t keep any in our apartment.” But Penny wasn’t listening, she gone back to rubbing her belly and making soft cooing noises. “What going on with her?” whispered Leonard to Sheldon.
“Judging by the amount of food packets on the floor she is probably half in a food coma, plus if she really is pregnant with that many the amount of nutrient taken from the blood could make her a bit light headed, not to mention the amount of hormones and associated mood swings,” replied Sheldon, “speaking of that we might not want to hang around.”
“Ooh,” said Penny giving a jolt, “they’re kicking, who wants to feel them kick?”
Both Bernadette and Amy wanted to, Bernadette tearing herself away from her questioning husband, whilst Amy knocked over a side table in her hurry. They bumped heads first go before placing an ear either side of the fleshy orb that was Penny’s belly.
“You might be right Sheldon,” said Leonard, “Raj, Howard, can you come outside for a moment.”
“What do you mean might be right,” squabbled Sheldon as the guys left, “I’m always right.”

When outside Leonard turned to the others, “Ok we got to find out what’s going on.”
“I thought that’s what we were doing in there,” said Raj.
“That’s just raising more questions,” said Leonard grabbing his car keys, locking the door, and heading down the stairs.
“Where are we going?” asked Sheldon.
“We’re nerds, we want to find something out, where do you think we’re going?”
“The Comic Book Store?”
“No the university.”

Not long after guys left the intercom in Penny’s apartment buzzed, Stephanie being the closet hefted herself up and answered it.
“Yes”… “We’ll be right down to collect it.” “It’s the pizzas,” she said to the room at large.
“So who’s going to get them?” asked Bernadette.
“Well think it should be one of you as I..” started Penny, before she was interrupted by a loud gurgle from Amy’s belly, whose was the largest of the other three, “in fact maybe I should go so they don’t get eaten on me.”
“So you mean they get eaten by you on the way back up here,” said Stephanie as Penny struggled to get up.
“We could all go,” suggest Bernadette.
“That would be over redundant,” said Amy.
“We could shopping as well,” continued Bernadette, “it is late night shopping and Penny needs some new clothes.”
“But the pizza,” said Penny weakly.
“We can eat them on the way,” said Stephanie.
“Ok, but you’re going to have to help me up, mommy’s a bit heavy,” said Penny.
It took the effort all of the others to get Penny unsteadily to her feet, after which they too headed out.
15112112211211121211211.title: Yes, they should

choices: Follow the girls at the mall
151121122112111212112111.content:
“This is not good, not good at all.” The two lanky alien figures were sitting in front of a computer console watching the progress of the Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj to the university.
“Oh you worry too much,” said the second figure.
“But they are suspicious, the other three were too much, and now they and going to cotton on to us and…” the first figure stopped as the other offered him a container of something.
“Nitrogen puff?” it said.
“How can you be eating Nitrogen puffs?” said the first.
“Well by altering the structure to make it a solid at ro…”
“I mean right now we’ve got four subject in progress with a total of forty offspring between them, with their friends now trying to find what’s going on, who I might add are considered to rather smart by Earth standards, HOW CAN YOU BE CONSUMING ZELLING NITROGEN PUFFS WHEN ARE ON THE BRINK OF BEING DISCOVERED?”
“They’re not going to expose us,” said the second one nonchalantly.
“Yes they are, one of them is astrophysicist and another is a…” garbled the first one
“They’re not going to expose us,” repeated the second, “Sure they might find us out, but what are they going do? They have no way of retaliating against us, they would dare harm the breeders, and no one is going to believe them if they try and tell them, they consider each of the others insane as it is.”
“I suppose you’re right, it was just simpler back when we took one at a time out in the country.”
“But we’re running out of time, we wasted too much time probing around trying to find out the difference between the genders. Beside these guys are probably not decisive enough to find us out, they fall to infighting over the smallest of things, I could watch them for about half an hour every planet rotation.”
“That would get too repetitive too quickly, probably half an hour ever seven planet rotations would be better, could you pass the Nitrogen puffs.”

“Do you ever get the feeling you are being watched?” asked Sheldon as the guys made their way through the corridors of the university.
“Yes,” said Leonard, “but then I figure it’s you using me as a lab rat for one of your social experiments and then I do something out of character.”
“You purposely mess up my data?!” exclaimed Sheldon.
“You never ask me if I want to part of your study.”
“How am I supposed to study you in your natural environment if you knew in an experiment?”
“Being a lab rat is not my natural in environment.”
“Guys,” interrupted Raj, “Where are we actually going?”
They stopped walking and there was a moment silence before Leonard said, “I was just heading to my office out of force of habit.”
“Honestly,” scoffed Sheldon as he started walking again. A couple of seconds later they were outside the door to Sheldon’s office.
“This is ‘your’ office” said Howard.
“There’s no need to sound like that,” said Sheldon, “I meant to come here.”
“Why?” asked Leonard.
“To use my computer as I didn’t have time to collect my laptop from home,” said Sheldon before opening the door.
Inside Sheldon’s office was Alex Jensen, Sheldon’s assistant, it was still debated by the others if he notice she was female when he hired her.
“Oh, Dr Cooper I have your sleep murmurings of last week summarized for your perusal.”
“Thank you Ms Jensen,” Sheldon crossing over his computer.
It was at that point Alex notice the others, “Hello Dr Hofstadter, Dr koothrappali, Dr..” she trail off, Howard was in space when introductions were given.
“Howard is not a Doctor Sheldon without looking up from his computer.”
“It’s good to see you…not bloated and surrounded by discard food packets,” said Leonard.
Alex looked slightly confused, “but I have never been bloated whilst surrounded by discarded food packets.”

“You’re cleaning this up,” said the first alien brushing some nitrogen puffs off their body.
“Forget about that ,” said the second, “do you see her,” they continued pointing at Alex on the screen.
“What are you attracted to Earthlings now?”
“No, don’t be absurd but she shows all the signs,” said the second pushing a few buttons. The screen changed to show a variety of graphs and alien numerical symbols. “Just as I thought, she is also perfect for breeding.”
“Now you’re being absurd, it was a fluke that the subject 568…” started the first.
“The maths is all there,” interrupted the second punch buttons
“You can’t be planning to inseminate her now!?” exclaimed the first.
“Of course not.”
“You are finally seeing sense.”
“Just as soon as the others leave the room.”
“But they already are suspicious.”
“You’re right, we should give her the growth accelerant as well,” said the second.
“But the complications, the only reason you gave it to the others was…” reasoned the first.
“If we give her the full sixteen it should increase the chances of some success.”
“Or more complications,” said the first but not too loudly, it was clear they were beaten, they continued more loudly, “Out of all the other members of our race that could of survived, why did it have to be you?”

“Okay,” said Sheldon straitening up from his computer and crossing the room, “I say we head to biology department, to see this list of ‘experts’,” he said gesturing to a message on his phone sent from his computer.
“I think tape worms are somehow,” said Raj after they left the office. As they made their way to the Biology department none of them notice the flash of light from under the door.
151121122112111212112111.title: Follow the guys to the university

choices: Return to the guys at the University
Follow the girls at the apartment
1511211221121112121121112.content:
Back at Penny's apartment...

Finally after some effort, the three bloated girls were able to help Penny up from the couch. "Whew," said Penny, giving her belly a rub,"that was tough." Amy, Bernadette, and Stephanie followed Penny closely out the door with pizzas in hand, making sure she didn't take a tumble down the long stairs.

Minutes later, they were at the bottom of the stairs, and entered Penny's car. Bernadette drove, as she was the smallest of the group, but not by much. Penny got the passenger seat to accommodate for her baby-filled belly, while Amy was behind Bernadette and Stephanie was behind Penny. The pizzas were between Stephanie and Amy, and all four girls were digging in. Penny was forced to move her seat back to give her pregnant belly some room. "Penny, I'm sorry, but can I have some leg room?" Stephanie said, annoyed. "Sorry, but you aren't pregnant with 10 babies, cut me some slack, I'm as big as a house!" she replied. Stephanie couldn't argue with that reasoning, so they remained silent, eating until Amy cut in. "Penny, you're check engine light is on, you should really get that checked out!" "Tell me about it" Penny replied dryly.

They arrived at the mall, with their hunger quelled for the time being. Their top priority was getting things that Penny and her babies needed. First, they bought two large cribs, baby clothes, and toys that they could play with. Next, they went to get clothes that would at least partially cover Penny's belly. The maternity store was filled with girls close to Penny's size, but none were bigger. She bought a few pairs of maternity jeans. She tried on the loosest shirts that they had, but she had a good feeling that they wouldn't fit her later in her pregnancy.

The girls approached the desk to check out their purchases. The cashier, a woman in her late 40s, eyed Penny suspiciously. "You're buying maternity clothes this late in your pregnancy? That's a bit different, you must be near full term!" "Actually I don't know when I'm due...I'm not having one baby, either..." Penny said. "So you're having twins, then? Still, you must be pretty far along..." the cashier said. Penny sighed as her babies kicked, rubbing her belly. "I'm actually having ten, at least..." she said. The cashier's jaw dropped. "Ten?!?! Wow....Congratulations, I guess..." "Thank you!" Penny smiled, turning to leave the shop. I wonder why the other pregnant women with her didn't buy anything... the cashier thought.

In unison, the four women's bellies groaned for food. They made their way to the food court, where they ate more than before. When all was said and done, Amy, Bernadette, and Stephanie appeared five months pregnant, their swollen bellies peeking out from beneath their shirts. "Ugh, I can feel this food moving around in there" Bernadette said, rubbing her belly. Amy and Stephanie agreed. "Your stomach is just trying to digest it, we've had a lot to eat today, so it's not a surprise that we're so bloated." Stephanie said. A loud burp escaped Penny's mouth, who looked pregnant with twins. After their latest feast, they left the mall to return to Penny's apartment.
1511211221121112121121112.title: Follow the girls at the mall

15112112211211121211211121.content:
“So we still have no idea what is going on,” stated Leonard as the guys made their way to the parking lot.
Howard looked at a piece of paper, “It could any number of things; gas, tumours, pseudocyesis, just a regular pregnancy or ‘we are insane’.”
“The last one seems most likely,” said Raj, “but I still think tape worms are somehow involved.”
“Maybe we should take them to the doctor tomorrow,” said Leonard.
“Stephanie is a doctor and she is also affected,” said Howard.
“A different doctor then.”
“But it might effect them as well,” said Raj.
“That’s is a point,” said Sheldon, “Penny was the first affected by these symptoms and the others who are affected are people who she have close contact with, I say we quarantine the lot of them until whatever it is runs its course.”
“You mean when they burst,” said Leonard.
“No no no no no, it would probably be more of a rupturing.”
“You’re unbelievable,” said Leonard. After dropping of Howard and Raj at their respective homes, Leonard and Sheldon returned to theirs.

The next morning after he got up, Leonard went out the main room to find Sheldon on the phone.
“I don’t care how sick you were this morning; you are not taking the day off.”
…
“Why? Because I’m taking the day off and if you also took the day off then nothing would be done.”
…
“Good,” he hung up the phone.
“How can you tell Alex not have a day off when you are taking one yourself?” asked Leonard.
There was a moment’s pause before Sheldon replied in his state the obvious voice, “Because I'm her boss,” there was another pause, before he continued in his condescending explaining things voice “now if she was ‘my’ bos…”
“You know she could report you for making her work whilst she is sick,” interrupted Leonard.
“If she is well enough to fill out one of those complaint forms she is well enough to work,” said Sheldon as though that was the end of the point.
“Why are you taking the day off?” said Leonard going on to a new one.
“After that late night last night I a…”
“You were in bed by one!”
“As I was saying, after that late night last night I am in no mind to work.”
“You still got up at you’re regular time and I suppose it is too much to ask that you took the day off to help you friends.”
“Leonard,” said Sheldon putting on what he thought was his kind face but really just made him look like he was on the toilet, “if you want help all you got to do is ask.”
“Really?” said Leonard slightly surprised.
“Of course,” said Sheldon picking up the phone and offering it to Leonard, “Now who do you want to ask for help, Howard or Raj?”

Later that morning at about eleven at the university. “Can I get some cwab sticks?” as Barry Kripkye. The woman serving the food shook her head, whilst trying to peer around Kripkye. “What about some Cawamawi?” again the woman shook her head. It was at that point that Kripkye noticed that nearly all the food in the serving display heater was gone, he then noticed that nearly everyone in the dining hall was looking at the same thing.
He turned to see Alex sitting at a table by herself, shovelling food into her mouth like there was no tomorrow. The table was covered in plate most now bereft of food, Kripkye tapped the man next to him professor Goldfarb, “What going on with her?”
“I don’t know, she has been eating since I got here.”
Professor Finkleday, who was sitting a nearby table with a now forgotten cup of coffee said, “She came in about an hour ago and just started ordering food, her shirt fitted at that point.” Barry then looked and saw the button up shirt Alex was wearing now stretched over a belly that looked like it should belong to a woman five months pregnant, flesh could be seen between the gaps.

Kripkye stood with the rest of them and watch Alex finish off the last of the food she had in front of her, she leaned back and gave a loud belch, there was a couple of pings as the lower buttons of her shirt flew off. Whilst they convince themselves that it was because that it was now free from its confines, but to the watching onlookers it seemed as though Alex’s belly was visibly growing to the stage where she looked full term. Everyone continued to watch, in complete silence, as Alex got up (after a few attempts) and waddled out of the dining hall, her belly groaning and bubbling and her now also larger rear swaying hypnotically as her pants stretched to contain it.

The silence continued for a moment after she left before Kripkye said, “Scwew this and heading off.”
“Screw what?” asked Goldfarb.
“If I wanted to see wadies taking their cwothes off, I would go to the stwip cwub near my pwace, at weast they have a fwee buffet there, and the girls don’t wook wike they have a watermewon growing in them.”
15112112211211121211211121.title: Return to the guys at the University

151121122112111212112111212.content:
The Next Day

Penny awoke with a start, as her babies kicked inside. She threw the covers off herself, and was in awe at the sight. Her belly had grown again, looking pregnant with triplets.

"Oh, boy."she said, running her hand over her large belly, feeling more kicking. Penny realized that she had to work at the Cheesecake Factory today. She attempted to rise from her bed, but it was a struggle. After a few attempts, she heaved herself from the bed. Penny removed the clothes she wore yesterday, and went to take a shower.

Like before, rubbing her belly was felt very good to her, and her many babies kicked strongly inside. Stepping out of the shower, Penny decided to get dressed. She put on a pair of panties and one of the larger bras, but it was the uniform that would be difficult. She was just barely able to put the skirt on. Penny tried to put the blouse on, but only the middle buttons would do, leaving an ample amount of cleavage and a bared belly. The yellow over-shirt would only go past her breasts, and the top of her belly. "Well, kids, time to go to work." she said, rubbing her belly.

Stephanie was at her home, getting ready for work at the hospital. This was difficult, because her belly was larger-much larger. She appeared nearly eight months pregnant. "Come on, come on!" she said, trying to button her pants. "Ah, screw it, I'm wearing sweatpants today!"she said. After putting on the sweatpants, she put on a t-shirt, which showed off the bottom half of her belly--popped-out navel and all. Grabbing her doctor's coat, she waddled to the door to leave. Then she felt it--a flurry of strong *THUMP*s coming from inside her belly. "Uh-oh." she said.

Amy Farrah Fowler was in her apartment, looking at her large eight months-sized belly in the mirror. "Please just be pseudocyesis."

Howard was washing up in the bathroom while his wife was stirring in bed. "Howie?"she asked. "Yeah Bernie?" "Could you come here?" Howard walked back to the bedroom. "Oh my god Bernadette!"he yelled. He saw her belly, which was the same size as Stephanie's and Amy's. But she looked the largest of the three, because the rest of her was so small. "I--I think I feel something moving in there!"she said, running a hand over her belly. Howard placed a hand to her stomach. "Ok, babe, I'm taking you to the hospital!"he said. He grabbed his turtleneck and left the house, Bernadette waddling behind, a hand on her belly for support.

On the way to the hospital, Bernadette's cellphone started to ring. "Hello? Oh hi, Amy--what? It's happening to you, too? Ok, we'll be right there." she said, hanging up the phone. They pulled up to Amy's apartment building, and saw her waddling out of the main door, her belly visibly sticking out from her usually large sweater. As Amy heaved herself into the car, they pulled off. "So, you too, huh?" Bernadette asked. "It looks like it. Stephanie will be meeting us there, and she'll take us into a private room to get examined. She's grown, too."

Howard pulled out his cellphone and called Leonard and Sheldon's number. It was Leonard who picked up. "Hey, Howard. Where are you, we're supposed to be watching the Doctor Who marathon." he said. "Something's come up. Meet me at the hospital, bring Raj and Sheldon along too." "Why?" Leonard asked. "Just do it. Your question will be answered once you see." "See what? Alright, fine. We're leaving now." he said, hanging up.

Arriving at the hospital, Howard helped Amy and Bernadette out of the car. Once they got in the hospital, they were greeted by Stephanie, her doctor's coat straining from her belly. "Hey, guys. It'll be just a few more minutes and then we can go in." As the girls were too big to fit in the seats, they stood in the waiting room, rubbing their bellies as whatever was inside continued to move around.
151121122112111212112111212.title: Follow the girls

1511211221121112121121112121.content:
The three swollen women went in the room whilst Howard waited out in the reception area for the others to arrive, Stephanie started to set up the ultrasound machine (hindered by her enlarged abdomen) Bernadette won the ponderous yet furiously fought race to the room’s only chair which she claimed by sitting in it with a definitive thud, this left Amy to heave her distended body onto the examination bed after several attempts.
“Where do you think Penny is?” asked Amy.
“I don’t think she would be too alarmed if she woke up like this,” said Bernadette.
“As she was this size when she went to bed,” finished Stephanie, “since you are on the bed we will exam you first,” continued Stephanie gesturing to Amy.
Amy laid back pulling up her sweater revealing the stretched skin of her swollen abdomen (part of which was visible before), “please tell me this is just my imagination or a sympathy pregnancy,” she said as Stephanie rub gel on her.
It wasn’t, all of them started at the screen without saying anything for a minute; the silence was broken by Stephanie, “Well it’s not as much a Penny but…”
“Eight is still quite a lot,” finished Bernadette, whose own belly squirmed reminding her of her own burden.
Examination of both Bernadette’s and Stephanie’s belly revealed them also to be carrying eight ‘bundles of joy’. “This is too unlikely to be a coincidence,” said Stephanie.
“Well…” began Amy.
“Don’t say anything,” snapped Bernadette, who had taken the new of her impending multi motherhood worst of all.
“We should find Penny,” said Stephanie, switching off the ultrasound, “see what’s going on with her.”
They started to waddle to the door when a loud groan emanated from Amy’s bulging belly which was quickly answered by both Bernadette’s and Stephanie’s.
“Perhaps we could stop to eat first?” said Amy.

Dr. Eric Gablehauser knocked on the door to Sheldon’s office, a rather muffled noise came from the inside, that indicated that he should could inside. He stared at the vision greeted him, of course he had heard that Alex Jensen had eaten a lot of food and now her belly was rather stuffed, in fact that was the reason he had came around to ascertain what had happen, he had brought some papers for Sheldon to sign but they had been more of an excuse. He could know see that the stories about Alex had been an understatement. The final few buttons done up on Alex’s shirt were fighting to contain her enlarged breasts, the rest of the buttons had lost against her immense belly which stuck out like a watermelon had grown inside her, whilst her hips and backside had also grown noticeably.
She looked up from the desk from which she had been leaning over, “Oh doctor Gablehauser,” she said straighten up her hands moving to the small of her back to help her compensate with her current weight, “is there anything I can help you with?”
It took Dr Gablehauser a couple of seconds to find his tongue, “uh yes, I’ve got some papers for Dr Cooper to sign.”
“Dr Cooper isn’t in today” said Alex “which is why he made me come to work today,” she added bitterly.
“In your condition?” asked Gablehauser, “he’s always been a bit out of touch like that,” he tried not to look around at the multitude snack food packets around the office it appeared she must of emptied every vending machine on this floor, “you can go home, or to the hospital if you prefer,” he said flusteredly.
“I’ll think I just go home until, the bloating goes away,” said Alex absentmindedly rubbing her belly.
“Bloating?! …fine whatever you want,” said Dr Gablehauser who didn’t find it comfortable being in the vicinity of a woman who ballooned up to be ready to pop with twins overnight, he edged his way over to the door, “and if doctor Cooper has any problems just tell him to talk to me.”
1511211221121112121121112121.title: Continue

choices: Follow the girls, who have an awkward conversation with the guys.
Follow Alex, who finally realizes her pregnancy.
15112112211211121211211121212.content:
The pregnant Stephanie, Amy, and Bernadette left the hospital in search of some food, before finding Penny. They waddled to Stephanie's car, and drove off, deciding to eat at the Cheesecake Factory. "So..." Stephanie began. "How could we all be pregnant? I mean, Bernadette I could understand, because she actually has a partner who gives affection to her, but it makes no sense! And with eight babies each?" Amy asked, rubbing the bare skin that poked out from the bottom of her sweater.

"I don't know. But it's just not right." Bernadette said, trying to avoid her pregnancy as much as possible. A few minutes later, they arrived at the Cheesecake Factory, and waddled inside.

To their surprise, Penny was working, and was much bigger than when they last saw her. She appeared to be nearing the size of a woman who was near term with quadruplets, and her massive belly was on full display, as her work shirt did nothing cover it. She was sweating heavily, as being a waitress while pregnant with sixteen alien babies is quite the workload. Penny did not notice the girls walk in, and they sat themselves.

They were just able to squeeze into a booth, as their bellies were pressed against the table. Penny waddled over, about to take their orders. Her eyes grew wide as she saw the bellies on Amy, Bernadette, and Stephanie. "What...what happened to you all?" she asked, her eyes as wide as her belly. "We're...pregnant. With eight babies. Each." Bernadette said. "Pregnant? Eight babies? What is going on?" she said.

While the girls searched for an answer, they stared at Penny's monstrous belly. Jabs and kicks were clearly visible against her skin. "I don't know, but I think that something's up. Especially with you, Penny. You're pregnant with over ten babies, and you look bigger than a house and you've been growing bigger and bigger by the day. How long will it be until you give birth?" Stephanie asked, feeling her own large bump.

"I don't know! This is the first time I've been pregnant after all!" Penny replied. "Tell you what. I'll take you to the hospital tomorrow to get another ultrasound, and maybe we'll pinpoint exactly how many babies you're having, and how far along you are." Stephanie quipped. "Maybe Bernadette and I should join you, after all, our pregnancies are probably similar." Amy said. They decided that this would be the plan. "Now, may I take your order?" Penny asked.

After nearly an hour of eating their makeshift feast, the three girls were stuffed to the brim, and their bellies were larger, looking full term with a single baby, possibly overdue. The girls agreed to meet up at Penny's apartment, where they would reveal their pregnancies to the guys. They waddled out of the restaurant, and headed to the apartment building, preparing to reveal their pregnancies.

We will then take her when the love struck sap takes her home, which he is offering to do right now. And plus, you're forgetting that guy comes from a culture that worships cows...Cows! Raj has successfully taken Lucy back to her apartment, and finally gets a call to Alex. He says, "Alex, your dad works for SETI, right?" She responds muffled from eating, "...Yeah..." 151122.content:
The Solar System, just outside the Earth's detection systems...

In the dark expanse of space, a massive starship comes out of warp and parks itself in the shadow of a satellite. Whether it was a planet, a moon, or rock, it didn't matter. Secrecy was important at this time, it didn't need the inhabitants of "Earth" to learn of their plan right away. Inside of the ship, are thousands of aliens. The aliens are 2 meters tall, digititrade legs, scaly blue skin, but yet very thin. They are dressed like the knights of a king, awaiting orders for war. At a part of a ship, four of these beings are in conversation with each other.

One is dressed in white robes and has several mechanical limbs attached to his back, this is Kabak, the leader of the Guild of the Smiths.

Another is a woman, you can tell from the shorter stature and the fact her skin is less scaly. She is dressed like the nomads of ancient times, carrying a staff in hand. This is Ravorzhazun, leader of the Shadow Walkers.

The next is a being of dark and blood red armor, his glowing red eyes the only visible aspect of his body, which produces a red mist. This is Alvanax, leader of the Forged Ones.

The last is a man wearing thick armor, making him look more muscular than his brethren. But what is unique is the crown on his head. It is made up of two parts, the bottom part resting on his head, like a true crown. But the top part floats above him in shards, making a new image every time he moves his head. This is Tassartadaris, leader of these people: The Daeloss, children of the stars.

Alvanax asks in his dark ways that make everyone believe he is a villain, "Must we waste time with creating an army like this? I understand that the dark one must be defeated, but this is a waste of time. Let me take a fleet of the Forged Ones and I will personally slit his throat!" Ravorzhazun hisses, "Learn your place before the Leader, Alvanax. My people and your People might have just been reaccepted into society, but that does not give to us the right to let hubris guide our ways!" Tassartadaris yells, "Enough! Kabak,finish your explanation."

Kabak clears his throat, "As I was saying, if we are to defeat the Dark One, we will need an army. But we need an army larger than the one we had before." Ravorzhazun asks, "You want us to find an army with more than 3 trillion soldiers? May I ask how we will do that when the maximum population our civilizations had at its highest was 1 trillion. And why must we bother with these 'Earthlings?' They only 7 billion lifeforms on the planet, and have yet to colonize another world." Kabak tells her, "There is an answer to all of that. Earthlings and Daeloss are able to reproduce with each other. We may have lost the drive to reproduce naturally long ago, but we are able to artificially inseminate their females with our young and start producing warriors at a fast rate. And once we have enough, we will...Forgive me if this doesn't sound right, Uplift them to become an advanced civilization as powerful as our own and let them join us with my prediction of 7 trillion warriors. My lord, what do you believe we should do?"

What do you answer?

choices: Right, to where the alien race sleeps
Left, to the lost technology with a mind of its own
1553121.content:
As was often the case, a typical day with the Doctor started with something wonderful or strange and turned into a horrible adventure. This only bothered Clara in that sometimes she'd just like for something to be uneventful. Not all things, not even most things, but every one in a while she'd like to not start the day on vacation and then end it running from some sort of artificial alien life form meant to protect crystal alien caves.

"You see, I thought they were here to keep us out, so of course we snuck in! I mean, what else am I going to do? But it turns out they're actually here to keep us in!" the Doctor was turning behind him as he ran, constantly looking down the shiny walls of the cave to see that the beast, while lumbering, was not exactly slow. Clara panted, right behind him.

"You don't say?" she said sarcastically.

They had entered through some cracks they found around the mountain, out of view from the entrance. The mountain looked like mundane stone from the outside, but inside the walls were lined with alternating smooth and jagged crystals. They were shifting and growing, too, almost alive. That's what the Doctor was looking for. He wanted to see how a mountain could be alive on a planet were all natural life aside from some grasses and moss died out long ago. This planet had been known for its genetic engineering and artificial life, and legend had it that that was their eventual undoing. They just engineered themselves out of existence, leaving on ruins and, apparently, these guardian beasts behind.

"It didn't start chasing us until we tried to run past it!" Clara said, implicitly blaming the Doctor for suggesting they make a mad dash for the entrance when their secret door proved too high up to get back out of.

"I didn't make a mad dash, you made a mad dash! I specifically said to walk briskly, not run!"

A roar that sounded almost musical echoed from the beast as it turned a corner and they caught side of it again. They were coming to a widening up ahead, with several paths. They almost ran off those paths, finding them to be steep descents into further caves, these less well lit than those they had been fleeing through. They had to stop. The Doctor looked left, right, clearly preparing to jump down one and skid to safety. He took Clara's hand.

"Watch it, now!" he advised, but as they were about to jump-Clara hadn't even given the unspoken plan a second thought-he stopped.

"What?" Clara asked, spinning around half expecting the creature to be on them.

It had stopped when they stopped. It's blank, eyeless face aimed towards them. It gave a very strange-sounding low growl that didn't exactly sound threatening.

"What's this?" the Doctor let go of Clara's hand, nudging her behind himself. He took a few steps. The creature hummed, moving backwards clumsily. He took another step. The creature did the same. Then he sprinted forward, just a few feet.

The beast bellowed and lunged forward. It had made it halfway towards them by the time the Doctor was holding up his arms and stopped moving.

"If it doesn't like running it's not going to like you," Clara said, understanding what was happening but not comprehending its significance.

"It definitely doesn't like us moving fast, let's see . . . " the Doctor strolled back and forth along the edge. The creature watched them, making some humming sounds. To Clara they almost sounded like a deep purring. The Doctor started slowly walking towards the creature.

"Doctor . . ."

The Doctor shushed her. As he slowly got closer, the creature started to turn, shaking the caves as he did so.

"Hold up, hold up," the Doctor said, careful not to move too fast. It was too late. The massive creature was already leaving. As a test, the Doctor jogged a few feet. The creature stopped and turned towards them, but sensing no further horseplay, walked away, its casual gate too fast for the Doctor and Clara to catch up with it without it chasing them down again.

Soon, it was out of sight, although the could hear its footsteps for a good while after.

"If only all aliens were that sensible," Clara smiled at the Doctor, "As long as you're not running at it or away from it it knows you must not be up to any mischief."

"Oh, does it it now?" the Doctor smiled back, turning to the paths before them. "Now then! Let's go explore us a cave."
1553121.title: The Crystal Caves of the Mountain of Crystals

choices: She checks out the chair (pregnant injection)
She checks out the screen (something crazier, maybe?)
15531212.content:
The Doctor and Clara followed the tunnel to the left on a whim. As they walked, the crystals lighting the way became more uniform, looking more and more like traditional lighting. Clara tapped one, noting that it was cold to the touch.

"What's this then?" the Doctor said as Clara turned back. He took a few quick paces ahead as the cave-now really more of a hallway-opened up to a large, smooth-floored cavern. The Doctor looked around in awe. The were machines lining the walls, wiring and pipes built into the walls. The whole place was carved to look more like a room than the rest of the caves, complete with a flat ceiling canvassed with metal support beams. Clara couldn't help but smile at the Doctor's enthusiasm. He burst into the center of the room, doing a little spinning dance thing.

"You don't see this every day, Clara!" he said. Considering the stuff she had seen with him, that he was that impressed must mean something. "Perfectly preserved lost technology of a long dead race! I know, I know, I ride around in one of those, but this is different. These are people who had almost no connection with mine, or any other major technological civilization of the last million years. This," he spread his arms, "is high technology in almost perfect isolation, almost perfectly preserved!"

He glanced around, not knowing where to go first. "Maybe completely perfectly!"

Clara wasn't quite as impressed as the Doctor. She saw what looked to be sleek, alien technology, but nothing more fantastic than what she had seen before on her travels with the Doctor.

"It looks pretty normal, from what I can tell," Clara said, egging him on.

"Normal? Normal? Is-is that normal?" he rushed towards what looked like a giant lamp with a ring of pitch-black beads held above it by stiff, thin wires. "I mean? Really? Is it normal? I don't even know."

That actually did impress Clara.

"Well, what do we look at first?" she asked, looking around, but the Doctor was already examining another equally baffling device. Clara saw towards the center of the room and to the side what looked like a padded dentist chair. She might assume what that might be for. On the other end was a large, blank screen, with a thick cord coming out of the back and leading to a box with innumerable switches and a small, blinking screen. That, too, caught her eye.
15531212.title: Isolated advancement is impressive, trust me.

choices: The Doctor manages to reverse it . . . for now
The Doctor stops the machine but can't reverse the effects.
155312122.content:
She heard the Doctor excitedly talking to himself from across the massive room.

"Well, I'll bet this device fixes broken bones! I forgot these people even had bones!"

Clara wandered over the screen device. It was against the wall away from other machines, with a few comfortable looking chairs nearby. The controls on the box gave nothing away. Only a few of them were even marked with anything that looked like letters. Clara assumed they must symbols rather than words, otherwise that TARDIS would translate them for her, wouldn't it? She didn't touch anything, however. She near enough to know that would cause nothing but trouble.

About ten feet from the screen at the center was a square on the floor. She bent down to look at it. It was a slightly raised block of metal built into the floor, probably with wires underneath heading to the screen. She stood up and looked towards the screen. She could see now that it wasn't completely black. There was a fluid, almost liquid texture to the surface. She was about to step forward to feel it when she stopped.

Or rather, Clara found she couldn't step forward at all. She was standing on the block, her feet spread out more than usual for simply standing, and was stuck.

"Oh, uh, Doctoooor . . . "she started to say but then looked to the screen. It flicked, then turned on, as far as she could tell. It still looked black, but that liquid sensation underneath started to flow and swirl. She couldn't move, or speak, or even turn away. Her eyes were dead set on the screen. She started to worry now, staring wide-eyed and open-mouthed as those swirls took on an extra dimension.

"Doctor . . ." she tried to yell but it only came out as a whisper. Her whole body tingled. She could feel something going through her, like the screen was transmitting information into her brain and body, analyzing it, and then trying again. Whatever this medical machine was doing she got the impression it didn't know how to do what it was supposed to do on humans.

Then a thought was forced into her head, so hard her ears rang and her breath was knocked out of her. Her hands moved to her middle as though they were moving through thick mud.

Pregnant the thought was, coming as an impression rather than a word.

"Waa-wwaait . . " Clara forced out, still in a whisper.

Something deep inside her turned. Under her hands she felt her stomach tighten and convulse. Her breathing quickened as panic set in.

Pregnant the impression came again, but it felt unsure now. Clara wasn't though. She knew what this machine was doing and would have give anything to have been able to run. But she couldn't run. She couldn't even look away.

Preparation the impression was almost like a question, like it was asking her what a human body needed to be pregnant. Clara didn't want to give it any response, and she didn't, at least knowingly. But it pulled information from her brain in no subtle or systematic manner, leaving her feeling dazed and light headed.

Her hands were still on her rolling stomach as she felt the top of her dress grow tight. Her breasts had swelled, she wasn't sure how much. It couldn't have been too much as her bra was still firmly in place, but any kind of sudden bodily transformation was too much as far as she was concerned. She managed to get out a quiet squeal of surprise.

Preparation came again, and then Pregnant began repeating in her brain until she could almost hear the word drowning out her thoughts. She felt her dress grow tight around her hips as her hips widened. Like her breasts, it couldn't have been a lot, but it was still too much.

Finally, the machine drumming into her brain, she heard a growling, sloshing sound from her middle. She felt something bump out of her stomach.

"Ooof, ooh," she moaned, bending over but being forced back up.

"Doctor!" she said, louder than before, the panic becoming too much even for the machine to completely quiet her. A warmth, and then a great pressure filled her stomach. Clara moaned, feeling her flat stomach press out into her hands in fits and starts.

"Do-doooctor!" she said again, this time in her normal speaking voice.

Everything in her stomach seemed to roll around again, and it pressed out again, straining her dress. She couldn't look down but could already tell that she now had a pregnant bump, round, firm, and unmistakable. Her breasts tinged again, growing tighter in her bra, feeling tender and sore, but what was happening inside her belly was still her greater concern.

Baaawooooomp came a sound from her stomach as the heaviness intensified. Her back arched. Clara gasped, tried to spread her feet further to steady herself. Something like first trimester passed through her brain, but it was fuzzy, and she was quickly beyond rational thought.

"Doctor, come here right now!" Clara finally screamed. She could hear him running, yelling "Clara!", but it sounded far away.

"What did you do?" the Doctor asked, looking in awe over her as he darted past her to the machine.

Annoyed, Clara forced out, "I didn't do anything, just stop it!"

"Okay okay okay," the Doctor waved around the machine, trying to find something he could use, glancing back at his companion's swollen form with worry and even fear.

"Don't worry, Clara, we'll fix this!" he said.

Clara felt the fullness inside her grow heavier. Her hips were starting to feel strained under the weight. No wonder the machine widened them for her.

"Hurry! It's growing too muc-oooaaaaah, just stop it!" Clara screamed. She as gripping her stomach as another surge swelled it out at least as far as her breasts. It was little consolation that the Doctor was panicking nearly as much as her. He was speaking to himself quickly now, but Clara couldn't make it out, just the peripheral images of him jumping around the machine, waving his sonic screwdriver over parts of it.

If he didn't do something soon, Clara thought, she'd either explode or give birth to . . . she didn't even want to finish the thought.
155312122.title: Pregnant machine

choices: They get out without a hitch and back to the TARDIS
Something, or someone, doesn't want them to leave
1553121221.content:
"Doc-tooor!" Clara screamed, as much as she could. Her movements were limited. It seemed the machine was only allowing her to spread her feet to stay standing, and to slowly move her hands down to her stomach. It was out far enough now that she could grasp its sides, feeling the tightness and the awkward, jolting movements inside.

"Stay calm, Clara, I'll fix this!" the Doctor said in a tone that did not calm Clara down.

He had seen a lot of technology, and so part of what was going on was familiar. He could see that it was making Clara pregnant, but he wasn't certain that this machine was entirely designed to only impregnate. And if it was, it would only be for this species. So it needed other data. He was able to detect that there was a feedback loop going on between the machine, Clara's brain, and the rest of her body. It was finding out what pregnancy was for a human, and then implementing it. But how well, he had no idea.

Bawoooooomp! The sound, low and deep, came from Clara's stomach. She gagged and thrust her head forward as her hips widened yet again. Her dress strained, the seams nearly ready to tear from both her stomach and hips now. Clara could feel it telling her, in its own way, to arch her back and jut her stomach forward, but she resisted. It didn't help, her stomach bulged outward in spurts despite her.

"What's happening to me?" she forced out.

First things first, the Doctor thought. First, he interrupted the mental feedback loop the machine was employing to gather what pregnancy was. Clara's eyes focused, and her breathing quickened. For the moment, she had control back.

"Oh god, what is this?" she said quietly, finally able to look down at her stomach. It was huge, maybe halfway to full term. She whimpered as she twisted to see her hips. On her otherwise still tiny figure they looked unnatural. Something lurched inside her and she doubled forward.

"Wait, Clara, I have this!" the Doctor reassured her. He restarted the loop, causing Clara's eyes to go blank, her movements to cease again. She wasn't sure this was for the best. The Doctor fed, the best he could, the reverse of the signal that he just interrupted. The effects were instant. A squirming, churning sound came from Clara's belly. She opened her mouth in a long, low moan.

"Clara? Clara, how does it feel?" the Doctor asked.

Clara rolled her eyes at him. Her stomach was retreating. She could feel it forcing itself back into its normal, flat self. Her hips, too, in two jarring motions, shrunk back to their normal size as well. Finally, the pressure in her bra eased as her breasts shrunk. The Doctor, determining that the process was complete, aimed his screwdriver at the machine and shut it off.

Clara stood for a moment, and then sunk down to the floor, her arms wrapped around her stomach. The Doctor rushed to her side.

"Clara, how do you feel? Are you okay?" he started to poke at her stomach, and Clara slapped him away.

After shaking for a few minutes, Clara's whole body calmed down. In fact, she fond it hard to believe anything had just happened. She kept rubbing her stomach, though, as if to make sure.

"It looks like everything is back to normal," the Doctor said scanning her.

"I . . . I guess I feel normal," Clara got to her feet. She was already feeling completely fine. The only evidence that anything had happened were that the seams on the side of her dress were one quick tear away from coming undone. "What was that?"

"That," the Doctor said, placing his hands on her shoulder to move her further from the machine. "is some of that ancient medical technology I was talking about. Why did you turn it on?"

Clara smacked him, half playfully, "I didn't turn it on, it captured me! And then . . I don't know-"

"Whatever else it does this machine was used to impregnate the race. I imagine it tried to do so with you, but didn't quite know how humans work."

"I really don't want to talk about this right now, Doctor," she said. "Can we get out of here?"

"Right, right," the Doctor said. "Let's slip past the guard monster. I'm sure we can outrun."

"We can try, because I am not spending another minute in this place," Clara shuddered, feeling her stomach again to make sure it was still flat.
1553121221.title: Reverse the polarity!

choices: It's a human pregnancy . . . caused by an alien machine.
It's a crazy, wacky, messed up alieny pregnancy.
15531212211.content:
The Doctor could tell Clara was upset, and Clara was actually quite touched by the Doctor's concerned. The whole way towards the entrance he kept asking how she was feeling, if anything didn't feel normal, and eventually Clara snapped at him. Snapped sweetly, but still snapped.

"Doctor, listen to me. I know it sounds strange, but I feel completely normal. I don't know if I ever felt anything that horrible, but now, it's like it never happened," then she added, "Thank you."

"Ah, well, that's all good then," the Doctor nodded, but still obviously intended to watch her closely. While he hadn't said why or if it was normal of him with his companions, but he always acted so jittery whenever any kind of harm came close to Clara. Clara took it for concern for a friend he was putting in danger, and yet there seemed to be something more there. She had gotten the impression he knew something, maybe something she should know too, but was never able to press the issue.

"Look," Clara said. They had come to one of the actual exits of the cave, not the hidden crevice they had sneaked in through. Two of the massive beasts lay in wait. But as they walked towards them, they both turned their backs to them and went into alcoves along the entrance. They went into sitting positions, then all but shut down. Cautiously, the Doctor and Clara approached. No movement. They walked directly between them. Nothing at all. They exited the cave unmolested.

"That's a relief," the Doctor said.

"No kidding," Clara said. "Doctor, what was that machine?"

The Doctor hesitated to answer, knowing Clara was still unnerved by having her body forcibly twisted against her will and something temporarily implanted in her.

"I don't think it was just a machine ti induce pregnancy," he said, "I didn't have a lot of time to study it, but I think it was an all-purpose medical bay. I think that if you showed it somebody with an issue, it could fix it. Broken bone? Healed! Cancer? Not anymore! I think it just has to be programmed beforehand. As far as I can tell the last time it was used some thousands of years ago it would have been to impregnate someone."

"But, if they have a machine like that, that can do anything, why have all that other equipment but only one of them? Wouldn't that replace all other medicine on the planet?"

They were making their way around the mountain to the TARDIS. It was a difficult hike but not a long one.

"Well, Clara, there's a lot nobody knows about these people. If I had to guess, and my guesses are rarely too far off as you know, I'd say that particular machine had some . . . bugs."

"Yes it did," Clara said, briefly flashing back to that first moment of panic as she felt her body changing and being unable to move.

"But we don't have to worry about that now, Clara. That machine told you you were pregnant, so I got the machine to tell you you weren't. It was a reverse feedback loop . . ." he went on like that for a few minutes. Clara listened, only caring that the general consensus was that the Doctor had completely reversed the effects.

Still, Clara vowed to make a very thorough examination of herself when they got the TARDIS. If she thought she looked the least bit bloated or her hips were half an inch wider, she'd dedicate the Doctor's time to making sure that everything really was back as it should be. She shuddered, not for the first time, then tried to push those thoughts to the back of her mind.

"Home sweet home," Clara said as they entered the TARDIS. "Doctor, I'd like to . . . have a little alone time if you don't mind."

The Doctor put his hands up in an understanding gesture, as if to say "Don't let me stop you." Clara went off to her room.

The Doctor bolted to the TARDIS's controls. He did his usual trickery, pulling on levers, thinking out loud, pressing buttons, looking at screens. He had the TARDIS scan Clara for any signs of change, particularly pregnancy.

The TARDIS came back with a negative reading, but with a catch. Something was definitely off with her, and whatever it was the TARDIS did not have a handle on what that was. The Doctor banged one of the control panels lightly.

"Why do I even trust you when it comes to pregnancies? You only ever give me the most frustratingly ambiguous answers."

Option 1: Clara is pregnant, but it will play out as close to a normal human pregnancy as possible. Maybe some catches will develop later on . . .

Option 2: Clara is pregnant, but it's a weird, mishmash parody of a human pregnancy as seen through an alien computer's eyes. Maybe she grows in spurts, or all at once, or experiences symptoms at random and to stranger degrees than normal.
15531212211.title: Back to the TARDIS

choices: Hunger! Go and eat for two or more
Milk! More swelling breasts for Clara
155312122112.content:
While the Doctor set about finding more about the technology that recently caused so much trouble, Clara tried her best to put it out of her mind. Fortunately for her, the TARDIS had an endless supply of things that could do just that. Even if they didn't stop at another place for weeks she was sure they could still find something to do without leaving it.

Clara found herself wandering a hallway leading to a room that looked to be an endless closet, racks of clothes stretching as far as she could see. Right next to it was another room, this one tall and cramped with large, blocky computers that could have come from the 50s. There was an unease in her, though. How could there not be, she reasoned? She had just been trapped by a machine as her brain yelled at her to be pregnant, and her body was helpless to obey. She began to relive the moments of panic again, feeling her stomach swell under her dress, her hips spreading, unable to flee and barely able to cry for help.

Clara was staring at one of the 50s-looking computers for a few moments before she caught herself.

Pregnant . . . pregnant . . . the thought, more than the idea, was going through her head. It reminded her too much of being under the control of that machine. Rubbing her temples, Clara backed out of the room, intending to head back to the Doctor. As she did so, she felt a more fully formed thought forcing its way into her mind like a blunt object. She leaned against the wall, one hand on her head and the other on her stomach.

"Uh oh,"she muttered, her voice shaking, "This isn't happening . . ."

Then, like a quick shout in her head, the thoughts forced their way into her.
155312122112.title: Sporadically pregnant

choices: She finds the Doctor and explains what happened
No chance to escape, another sympon hits Clara
1553121221121.content:
The thought forced its way into Clara's mind like a punch.

Hunger! Nutrients! Food! Clara held her head as each throbbing thought felt less like a command and more liker her own will.

"Aaah, I'm not even hungry!" she said out loud hoping to convince her mind of it. Her stomach rumbled, quietly at first, but then grew into a steady bubbling growl. Soon, Clara was leaning against the wall with her hands pressed firmly into her stomach.

Eat! Eat! Eat! the simple thought boomed through her head. It was like a migraine with words. Her tummy not only growled now, it pulsed and squirmed grossly under her hands.

Before she even knew it, Clara was walking, her arms wrapped tightly around her middle. She wasn't positive where she was going, except that every part of her was demanding food and the only counter argument she could muster were some sad squeaks of protest. The village was small. There couldn't have been more than forty, fifty people in it, and all of them were tending to the fires, sitting with their young, or preparing large wooden bowels of fruit and meat to cook over the fire.
