choices: Things get out of hand at the party (RESERVED)
155332222222211.content:
Valentine's Day was always one of Amy Santiago's favorite holidays, and now that she was with Jake she knew she'd like it even more. That morning at the precinct, they were finishing some paperwork at their desks when they were approached by Captain Holt.

"Good morning, you two. I just received word that there's a drug deal happening at the docks in about half an hour. Peralta, I'd like you to accompany Santiago to help stop it," he said.

"On it!" Amy said as she stood up, her enthusiasm evident even this early in the morning.

Jake scratched his head. "Come on, Captain! It's Valentine's Day! Shouldn't you be a little happier than you usually are? I mean, I know that's hard, since you're always so chipper, but still."

"Peralta, rest assured I am absolutely giddy on the inside. Docks. Thirty minutes. Don't let them get away with it."

Captain Holt returned to his office, leaving them alone.

"Come on, Jake," Amy said, and they left the precinct and headed towards the docks.

~~~~~~~~~~~

At the docks, Amy and Jake sat in a car across the street from where the deal was supposed to go down. Amy was using binoculars to get a better look.

"So what do you want to do tonight?" he asked.

"Jake, we have the office party. Remember?"

Jake sighed. "Do we really have to go to that?"

"It'll be fun! There's gonna be alcohol, too..." Amy said.

"Oh, I do like alcohol. Is that them?" Jake asked.

He pointed to a man and a woman standing suspiciously on the sidewalk across from them. They stood in front of a crate, and they appeared to be waiting for someone.

"Looks like it. Let's go," Amy said, exiting the car.

Jake followed her lead, and they approached the man and woman.

"You here for the pills?" the man asked under hushed breath.

Jake nodded. "Yeah. We're here for you, too. NYPD, you're under arrest."

Jake and Amy flashed their badges, and the crooks shook their heads.

"Damn it! I told you we should have been more discreet!" the woman said.

"Then the buyers wouldn't have been able to find us!" the man replied.

They shoved them into the back of the car and returned to the precinct.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

"Well done, officers," Captain Holt said as Jake and Amy entered the office with the crate.

"Thank you, Captain!" Amy said.

"Can we go home now? I think we've done enough for today," Jake said.

"No."

Jake nodded. "Right. Thought I might give it a shot."

Captain Holt looked at the crate on the ground. "What's in there?"

"No idea. One of them mentioned that they were pills, but I don't know exactly what they are," Amy replied.

Holt nodded. "Put it in the evidence room for now."

The rest of the day went by as normal, and eventually the Valentine's Day party began.
155332222222211.title: Amy (and others) [RESERVED]

1553322222222111.content:
The evening started off slowly, with the only people in the precinct being Jake and Amy, and Boyle and Genevive. The two couples conversed slowly, feeling awkward as the only people there.

”Im gonna grab something to drink, ease the ol’ awkwardness. Want anything?” Jake asked Amy.

”Yeah, grab me a drink as well. Talking about different ways to cook vegetables gets really old, really fast!” Amy whispered back, trying not to let Boyle hear her.

Jake returned with two drinks in his hand. The two downed their drinks quickly and resumed their conversations. As time passed, more and more people turned up, giving Jake and Amy an opportunity to talk about something else.

Eventually Amy was sat down with Boyle in the break room, talking about his son, Nickolaj.

”Aw Charles! His little police costume is so cute!” Amy said, fawning over the pictures on Boyles phone.

”Yeah, he said he wants to be just like his Daddy!” Boyle replied, smiling proudly. ”You know he would love a little playmate” he added, nudging Amy.

”Oh no, not yet. Jake and I both don't think that were ready for a kid yet” Amy said.

”Aw come on, you guys would ace it! Nickolaj loves it when you guys babysit!” Boyle said.

”When we’re ready, we'll tell you first, Charles” Amy said. ”But please don't tell us about ’optimum positions or whatever”

As the evening wore on, and more drinks were drunk, people started to get hazy. Amy tried her best to look sober, but only added to her drunkenness, slurring more and more words as she spoke. She stumbled into the evidence locker, and found Gina and Rosa stood, discussing something.

”What’re youu two doing?” she stammered.

”Gina says wee should retry these pills” Rosa replied, equally drunk as Amy.

”What, no-one will know if three are gone!” Gina added, not quite as far gone as the other two.

Ah what the hell, Amy thought, grabbing one of the pills and swallowing it whole. It tasted sweet as she swallowed it, and she opened her mouth to show the other two. ”A-all done!”

Gina and Rosa both quickly followed suit, swallowing the pills, and the three of them waited for them to kick in. They waited a few minutes before realising that nothing was gonna happen.

”That sucked, ” Rosa said, sounding slightly annoyed.

”They t-tasted good though!” Amy said, grinning.

After a while the party began to quiet down and everyone started to leave, Jake and Amy included. The two grabbed a taxi back to their apartment, and as soon as they got in, they were all over each other, making out and undressing easily on the way to their bedroom.
1553322222222111.title: Things get out of hand at the party

15533222222221111.content:
Amy woke up with a pounding headache, the night before getting its revenge. She slowly opened her eyes and immediately began to regret it, shutting her eyes quickly to avoid the burning light flowing in from the window.

She tried opening her eyes again, this time being able to keep them open for longer. She looked to her side and saw Jake splayed across his side of the bed, fast asleep. She rolled over and grabbed her phone, quickly turning the brightness down.

“Crap! Jake we need to go, we’re late!” She exclaimed, rubbing her temples to soothe her headache.

Jake simply groaned in response and didn’t move from his spot.

“Come on Jake, seriously!” She said, getting up and out of bed, trying to work through her hangover.

“Too early” he grumbled.

“Its almost 8:30. Oh god, Holt is going to be so mad!”

Eventually Jake crawled out of bed, but by that point Amy had already gotten dressed, had breakfast and was ready to go. She sat i the kitchen and waited for Jake, holding her head in her hands and sipping on a cup of coffee. Jake walked out of their bedroom, dressed and ready to go, and the two set off to work.

When they arrived at the precinct they both put on a pair of dark sunglasses and made a brisk walk into the building and then into the lift. The doors opened and they walked out and saw the others.

Charles was sat with his head on his desk doing some paperwork, looking like he was trying not to fall asleep, Gina was reclining in her chair with a pair of thick sunglasses on, scrolling through her phone. Rosa was working on some files, lazily sifting through the pile on her desk, and the sarge was sat at his desk, completely fine, tucking into a blueberry yougurt.

Jake and Amy quickly walked to their desks and sat down, thankful that almost everyone was too hungover to notice them come in late. Terry gave the two of them a look of slight disappointment and amusement, leaving both of them sighing and settling into their seats.

“Peralta, Santiago, come into my office” Captain Holt said, sounding too loud for the hungover members of the nine nine.

Jake and Amy both walked gingerly into the captains office, and sat on his couch, sinking into the cushions.

“I noticed that the two of you were late. Peralta, I expected, but Santiago..” he said, leaving Amy with a horrified look on her face. “However, since it was the Valentines party last night i will let the two of you off”

“Thank you sir, it won’t ever happen again” Amy said, trying to sound enthusiastic.

“Dismissed” he said, and the two detectives walked back to their desks.
15533222222221111.title: The next morning

155332222222211111.content:
As the morning dragged on, the group begam to wake up and shake off their hangovers, especially after a good pizza from the place down the street. Jake and Amy began to get back to work on their case, going through a few files on it.

“How you holding up?” Jake asked, looking up at Amy.

“Good, just a headache at this point” Amy replied, massaging her temples with one hand.

“Cool, coolcoolcool” Jake said. “I found a link to a potential dealer, wanna go check it out?”

“Yeah, lets grab a coffee and get going” Amy said, standing up and grabbing her badge and gun.

— — — -

A few weeks after the party, and Jake and Amy still hadn’t found the main source of the drugs. Adding onto the stress of the case, Amy had come down with a virus or something, which had put her out of commission, to her annoyance.

“Keep me posted on the case babe” she called to jake, as she lay in bed.

“Will do, but remember to take it easy” Je replied. “Love you!” He added, before she heard the door close.

Amy lay in bed for a while longer, before ahe got out of bed to try and do something nore interesting than watching crappy daytime TV. She wandered around the apartment aimlessly for a while, taking several breaks to vomit. She eventually got some paperwork to finish, to take her mind off her illness.

Jake walked into the precinct, and walked to his desk, sitting down opposite amys empty seat.

“Hey, Charles, where are Rosa and Gina? Still sick?” He asked, starting to get to work.

“Yeah, that virus is still with them. Amy still ill as well?” Charles replied.

“Huh, remind me to send them all get well soon cards” Jake mused.
155332222222211111.title: They carry on the case
